tasks.task: Understand the role of farm animals in agriculture and aspects related to farming practices, such as breeds, housing, management, health, nutrition, breeding, animal welfare, and sustainability.
subtasks: Identify different farm animal breeds and their specific purposes (e.g., dairy, meat, dual-purpose).
Analyze proper housing and management practices for various species (e.g., barns, pens, pastures) considering shelter, space, ventilation, sanitation, and specialized facilities.
Evaluate the importance of veterinary care, including vaccinations, deworming, hoof trimming, and preventive measures for maintaining farm animal health and productivity.
Assess the role of nutrition in farm animal development and productivity, including dietary balance and feed formulation for energy, protein, vitamins, and minerals.
Examine breeding programs aimed at selecting desirable traits and improving the genetic potential of herds or flocks.
Consider animal welfare standards and sustainable farming practices, such as rotational grazing, integrated pest management, and conservation tillage.

Recognize the significance of farm animals in providing essential products (meat, milk, eggs, wool, leather) and services (pest control, soil fertility, nutrient cycling) for agriculture and food systems.
